trans-unit.source: Using the QuickBooks Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the QuickBooks Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the QuickBooks Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the QuickBooks Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the QuickBooks Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the QuickBooks Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Use the QuickBooks connector to create and modify different QuickBooks entities.
trans-unit.target: Use the QuickBooks connector to create and modify different QuickBooks entities.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the supported entities:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the supported entities:

trans-unit.source: Entities
trans-unit.target: Entities

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Account
trans-unit.target: Account

trans-unit.source: Account is a component of a Chart Of Accounts, and is part of a Ledger.
trans-unit.target: Account is a component of a Chart Of Accounts, and is part of a Ledger.

trans-unit.source: Used to record a total monetary amount allocated against a specific use
trans-unit.target: Used to record a total monetary amount allocated against a specific use

trans-unit.source: CreditMemo
trans-unit.target: CreditMemo

trans-unit.source: The CreditMemo is a financial transaction representing a refund or credit of payment or part of a payment for goods or services that have been sold.
trans-unit.target: The CreditMemo is a financial transaction representing a refund or credit of payment or part of a payment for goods or services that have been sold.

trans-unit.source: Customer
trans-unit.target: Customer

trans-unit.source: A customer is a consumer of the service or product that your business offers.
trans-unit.target: A customer is a consumer of the service or product that your business offers.

trans-unit.source: Estimate
trans-unit.target: Estimate

trans-unit.source: The Estimate represents a proposal for a financial transaction from a business to a customer for goods or services proposed to be sold, including proposed pricing.
trans-unit.target: The Estimate represents a proposal for a financial transaction from a business to a customer for goods or services proposed to be sold, including proposed pricing.

trans-unit.source: Invoice
trans-unit.target: Invoice

trans-unit.source: An Invoice represents a sales form where the customer pays for a product or service later.
trans-unit.target: An Invoice represents a sales form where the customer pays for a product or service later.

trans-unit.source: Additional information about using the Invoice data model can be found here.
trans-unit.target: Additional information about using the Invoice data model can be found here.

trans-unit.source: Item
trans-unit.target: Item

trans-unit.source: An item is a thing that your company buys, sells, or re-sells, such as products, shipping and handling charges, discounts, and sales tax (if applicable).
trans-unit.target: An item is a thing that your company buys, sells, or re-sells, such as products, shipping and handling charges, discounts, and sales tax (if applicable).

trans-unit.source: An item is shown as a line on an invoice or other sales form.
trans-unit.target: An item is shown as a line on an invoice or other sales form.

trans-unit.source: SalesReceipt
trans-unit.target: SalesReceipt

trans-unit.source: This entity represents the sales receipt that is given to a customer.
trans-unit.target: This entity represents the sales receipt that is given to a customer.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the QuickBooks Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the QuickBooks Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: QuickBooks Actions
trans-unit.target: QuickBooks Actions

trans-unit.source: Following are the different actions available in QuickBooks connector.
trans-unit.target: Following are the different actions available in QuickBooks connector.

trans-unit.source: Action
trans-unit.target: Action

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Read Entity
trans-unit.target: Read Entity

trans-unit.source: Read entity object
trans-unit.target: Read entity object

trans-unit.source: Create Or Update Entity
trans-unit.target: Create Or Update Entity

trans-unit.source: Create or Update entity object.
trans-unit.target: Create or Update entity object.

trans-unit.source: Object is updated if it already exists else a new object is created
trans-unit.target: Object is updated if it already exists else a new object is created

trans-unit.source: Delete
trans-unit.target: Delete

trans-unit.source: This action deletes specified object from selected entity
trans-unit.target: This action deletes specified object from selected entity

trans-unit.source: Query
trans-unit.target: Query

trans-unit.source: The query operation is the method for creating a guided query against an entity.
trans-unit.target: The query operation is the method for creating a guided query against an entity.

trans-unit.source: Create a QuickBooks Connector API App
trans-unit.target: Create a QuickBooks Connector API App

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option at the bottom right of the Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure Marketplace using the + NEW option at the bottom right of the Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: Browse to “Web and Mobile > API apps” and search for “QuickBooks”.
trans-unit.target: Browse to “Web and Mobile > API apps” and search for “QuickBooks”.

trans-unit.source: Configure the QuickBooks Connector by providing the details for Hosting Plan, the resource group and selecting the name of the API App.
trans-unit.target: Configure the QuickBooks Connector by providing the details for Hosting Plan, the resource group and selecting the name of the API App.

trans-unit.source: Configure the QuickBooks Entities you are interested in reading/writing in the 'Package Settings'.
trans-unit.target: Configure the QuickBooks Entities you are interested in reading/writing in the 'Package Settings'.

trans-unit.source: With this, you can now create a QuickBooks Conenctor API App.
trans-unit.target: With this, you can now create a QuickBooks Conenctor API App.

trans-unit.source: Create a Logic App
trans-unit.target: Create a Logic App

trans-unit.source: Let us create a simple logic app that creates an account in QuickBooks and update 'Category Type' of the same account.
trans-unit.target: Let us create a simple logic app that creates an account in QuickBooks and update 'Category Type' of the same account.

trans-unit.source: Login to Azure Portal and click on ‘New -> Web + mobile -> Logic App’
trans-unit.target: Login to Azure Portal and click on ‘New -> Web + mobile -> Logic App’

trans-unit.source: In the ‘Create logic app’ page, provide the required details such as name, app service plan and location.
trans-unit.target: In the ‘Create logic app’ page, provide the required details such as name, app service plan and location.

trans-unit.source: Click on ‘Triggers and Actions’ and the Logic App editor screen comes up.
trans-unit.target: Click on ‘Triggers and Actions’ and the Logic App editor screen comes up.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Run this logic manually’ which means that this logic app can be invoked only manually.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Run this logic manually’ which means that this logic app can be invoked only manually.

trans-unit.source: Expand ‘API Apps in this resource group’ in Gallery to see all the available API Apps.
trans-unit.target: Expand ‘API Apps in this resource group’ in Gallery to see all the available API Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘QuickBooks Connector’ from the gallery and the ‘QuickBooks Connector’ gets added to the flow.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘QuickBooks Connector’ from the gallery and the ‘QuickBooks Connector’ gets added to the flow.

trans-unit.source: You would have to authenticate and authorize logic apps to perform operations on your behalf if QuickBooks online.
trans-unit.target: You would have to authenticate and authorize logic apps to perform operations on your behalf if QuickBooks online.

trans-unit.source: To start the authorization click Authorize on QuickBooks Connector.
trans-unit.target: To start the authorization click Authorize on QuickBooks Connector.

trans-unit.source: Clicking Authorize would open QuickBook’s authentication dialog.
trans-unit.target: Clicking Authorize would open QuickBook’s authentication dialog.

trans-unit.source: Provide the login details of the QuickBooks account on which you want to perform the operations.
trans-unit.target: Provide the login details of the QuickBooks account on which you want to perform the operations.

trans-unit.source: Grant logic apps access to your account to perform operation on your behalf by clicking Authorize on the consent dialog.
trans-unit.target: Grant logic apps access to your account to perform operation on your behalf by clicking Authorize on the consent dialog.

trans-unit.source: Once the authorization is complete, all the actions are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Once the authorization is complete, all the actions are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Create Or Update Account’ action and the input parameters are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Create Or Update Account’ action and the input parameters are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Provide ‘Name’ and 'Account Type' and click ✓.
trans-unit.target: Provide ‘Name’ and 'Account Type' and click ✓.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘QuickBooks Connector’ from the ‘Recently Used’ section in the gallery and a new QuickBooks action gets added.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘QuickBooks Connector’ from the ‘Recently Used’ section in the gallery and a new QuickBooks action gets added.

trans-unit.source: Select ‘Create or Update Account’ from the list of actions and the input parameters of the action are displayed.
trans-unit.target: Select ‘Create or Update Account’ from the list of actions and the input parameters of the action are displayed.

trans-unit.source: Click on ‘+’ next to ‘Id’ to pick the id value from the output of Create Account action.
trans-unit.target: Click on ‘+’ next to ‘Id’ to pick the id value from the output of Create Account action.

trans-unit.source: Provide new values for Account Type and click ✓.
trans-unit.target: Provide new values for Account Type and click ✓.

trans-unit.source: Click on OK on Logic app editor screen and then click 'Create'.
trans-unit.target: Click on OK on Logic app editor screen and then click 'Create'.

trans-unit.source: It will take approximately 30 seconds for the creation to complete.
trans-unit.target: It will take approximately 30 seconds for the creation to complete.

trans-unit.source: Browse the newly created Logic App and click on 'Run' to initiate a run.
trans-unit.target: Browse the newly created Logic App and click on 'Run' to initiate a run.

trans-unit.source: You can check that a new account by name 'Contoso' gets created in your QuickBooks account.
trans-unit.target: You can check that a new account by name 'Contoso' gets created in your QuickBooks account.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
